isis.stitle: 9 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS INTERNATIONAL PS125-9A, PS140-9A, PSO125-9A, PSO140-9A AND PSO150-9A - GENERAL INFORMATION - LUBRICATION PUMP

svcproc.title: LUBRICATION PUMP
svcproc.para: Optional lubrication pumps are available for all models. To properly install the unit, follow the instructions given below.

step1.para: Remove the range rear bearing cap and gasket from the right side of the transmission.
Install the countershaft pump bearing cap gasket and bearing cap, making sure the oil cavities point upward. Secure the gasket bearing cap with four capscrews, and tighten them to 34-41 ft-lbs.
Next install the pump gasket and pump. The pump shaft inserts into the countershaft end groove. Secure the pump body onto the bearing cap with four capscrews. Tighten to 13-17 ft-lbs.
Install the 90° elbow and nipple in the upper pump port hole, with the threads pointing toward 4 o'clock. Also install an elbow in the pump lower port hole with the threads down.
Install the oil screen filter into the center drain hole on the rear of the transmission case. Connect the hose assembly between the oil screen filter and the elbow at the bottom of the pump.
Connect the bushing reducer to the oil cooler at both the outlet and inlet (top and bottom) port holes. Use the adaptor fitting to do this. Also install the oil cooler in the air flow.
Remove the pipe plug from the top right side of the transmission main case. Then install the elbow with the threads to the right.
Continue by attaching a hose and fitting to the pump outlet connector (upper port). Connect the opposite end of the hose to the cooler inlet adaptor.
Connect the elbow on top of the main case to the cooler outlet with the correct Weatherhead hose and fittings.
Prime the oil cooler system and pump.

Fill the transmission with oil. Start the vehicle and check for leaks and proper oil cooler system operation. After the initial start up, check the oil level. If needed, add oil until the oil level is even with the transmission filler hole.
